p.s: Brexit is clearly a lose-lose situation for both is the claim of Michel Barnier in his speech when talking about the withdrawlwithdrawal of the UK from the European Union.
In the text below, I would like to comment on that statement and explain why he may be mistaken with his assumption.
Firstly, it is a well-known fact that the UK was one of the most important states of the EU.
Its drop out the EU will certainly change the relationship between the both.
First of all, critics of the EU in the UK were claiming that the EU had taken too much power from the UK government with regulations that were costly for the economy of the UK.
However, outside the EU market and its shared regulations the UK would be able to establish a new relationship with the EU without being bound to its laws.
And the UK could decide over itself.
Furthermore, there are aspects and decisions that were made within the EU which Britains had great effect effect on and which could be different without the votes of the Britains, for ex.
There would be probably more red tape within the EU and higher contributions from the remaining members without opposition of the UK.
It may be true that there is at the moment some difficulties both have to deal with for exexample.
the worker shortages in the UK and as a result the probably higher unemployment rate in the EU, however the UK would be able to sign new trade deals with other growing economies for ex.
Additionally Britain has no big influence on the EU, so from outside the EU it could retake seats on international institutions.
It also could set new rules to encourage innovation and have the right to decide over itself as the citizens decided with the referendum.
Another significant point is that the UK and the EU have shared values and narrow ties that would help them to hold together.

So, yes even though the UK and the EU would have a different kind of relationship and would face some troubles at the beginning, I think that the two powers are able to handle the situation and draw new ways and visions for the future.
